intro: Lappula skorpili, commonly known as lesser lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides or in meadows. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the summer months. The leaves are lance-shaped and can be hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
